Thanks for making this change. I was planning to add integration test for TES and these util methods would help me save some effort. Overall this should work after you fix Action in cert policy.

What do you think about keeping it false by default? If I just want to run the kernel then I don't want to provision by default and just run the kernel with kernel args. I think the times at which you want to provision a device is limited and special (for example booting up), but a kernel restart/rerun can happen in different situations like device reboot, service restarts, etc. where you probably do not want to provision again. Explicitly specifying provisioning makes more sense to me.
Agreed, it should be off by default.

It would be good to have a README to explain the usage of this script. Add details of assumptions for using this script, for example the credentials and what a user needs to do to ensure that.
How does a customer get details on usage of every parameter?

A README is helpful when they have access to the script code, this script is currently going to be part of the JAR, if it's moved out of the JAR then the AWS documentation can be used as a guide. So I think what will help them better w.r.t this script is adding a --help option like any other CLI, I'll need to give it some time though
It is going to be open source so they will have access to the script. help works too. We will need AWS documentation anyways.
+1. Even for ourself it is useful.
I think this name should indicate that this role is for TES
Can I provide credentials as well as part of the arguments?
I thought for the initial version we expect the creds to be present in env vars, isn't that what the requirements doc suggested?
yep, ideally would be able to get from CLI also, but I'm good with just envvars for now

Yes the initial version expects the creds being present as env variables. Din mean to extend scope, but a TODO to do that later should suffice for now. Was just thinking from a customer experience POV

Right now if a parameter to script is not specified, it is assumed to use the default values. There is no flag to say I want to use default values or just want partial updates to provisioning.
As I understand only IotThing creation is going to stay here in long term and other things are temp. So its ok not to support partial provisioning updates.

Could you clarify a little bit? are you saying we need to make changes to this right now or not? If I understand correctly you mean IoTThing provisioning is only what is going to stay so we don't bother about the 'partial' flag right now?
Yes your understanding is correct. We don't bother about partial flag right now.
